result.markdown:
---
title: "Classification"
author: "Julia Gutgesell"
date: "2023-11-19"
categories: [news, code, analysis]
---


Unlike clustering which is an unsupervised technique, meaning that there are not labels or classes on the data, classification is the process of assigning data points to one of the predetermined classes given.

![](classification.png)

One clustering algorithm is **Decision Trees**, which learn decision rules from data features to build a tree that can be followed to determine the chosen class for a new data point. 

![](tree.png)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(222)
index <- sample(2, nrow(iris), replace = TRUE, prob = c(0.7, 0.3))
train <- iris[index==1,]
test <- iris[index==2,]
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tree)

irisTree <- tree(Species ~ ., data = train)
plot(irisTree, lwd = 2)
text(irisTree, cex = 0.7)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
predict_frame_iris <- data.frame(test, prediction = predict(irisTree, test, type = "class"))

library(caret)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Loading required package: ggplot2
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Loading required package: lattice
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
(train_tab = table(predict_frame_iris$Species, predict_frame_iris$prediction))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            
             setosa versicolor virginica
  setosa         18          0         0
  versicolor      0         15         0
  virginica       0          3        13
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
train_con_mat = confusionMatrix(train_tab, positive = "setosa")
train_con_mat
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

:::
:::



**Random Forest**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(randomForest)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
randomForest 4.7-1.1
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Type rfNews() to see new features/changes/bug fixes.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```

Attaching package: 'randomForest'
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
The following object is masked from 'package:ggplot2':

    margin
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
randomforest <- randomForest(Species~., data=train, proximity=TRUE)

p2 <- predict(randomforest, test)
confusionMatrix(p2, test$Species)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
